1.Body:
*WHO*,

PUT MESSAGE HERE

To add/correct details about your business, contact information, your product descriptions, pitch and power requirements, update your Insurance and Risc Assessment etc. Visit *LINK*

Details of your pitch location, general trader information and particulars of setup and clear down information will also appear there.

If you are no longer trading, or no longer wish to be notified about trade stands at the festival click *HERE*.

2.Body:
*WHO*,

Trade stand booking for the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival in *THISYEAR* is now open.

*LIMITED* Please use this personal *LINK* to directly add and/or correct details about your business, contact information, your product descriptions, book or change your pitch(es) and give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

Details of your pitch location, general trader information and particulars of setup and cleardown information will also appear through the link.

Save the link for future use. If you lose or forget it you will be able to request a new personal link from the website (as soon as trade appliactions go public).

If you have any queries that are not answered by the Trade FAQ, please contact trade@wimbornefolk.co.uk.

If you are no longer trading, or no longer wish to be notified about trade stands at the festival click *HERE*.

4.Body:
*WHO*,

Thankyou for submitting your application for Trading at the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival in *THISYEAR*.

Please use this *LINK* to add/correct details about your business, contact information, your product descriptions, book or change your pitch(es) and give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

The trade address *MAILTO_trade* will reach Moe who can help you with everything else, including requests for a different location.(If you don't a reply from Moe after 7 days, your fallback contact is Brian Harries brianlloydharries@gmail.com )

Please use this *LINK* to add/correct details about your business, contact information, your product descriptions, book or change your pitch(es) and give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

Details of your pitch location, general trader information and particulars of setup and clear down information will also appear there.

Save the link for future use.

*DETAILS*

5.Body:
*WHO*,

As one of last year's traders at Wimborne Minster Folk Festival, you're being given an advance opportunity to book a pitch this for *THISYEAR* before we open booking to everyone.

The dates are *DATES*.

The location you are being offered is *LOCATION* at a price of *PRICE*.

If you wish to accept the offer of a pitch at the quoted price, go to your personal *LINK* and click 'accept'.

Shortly after accepting the offer, you will be sent an invoice for a deposit. To secure the pitch, you must pay your deposit promptly.

If you wish to decline the offer, please click on your personal link and click 'decline'.

Please do NOT address any queries to our treasurer unless they are related to payments. She's a very busy woman. The trade address trade@wimbornefolk.co.uk will reach Moe who can help you with everything else, including requests for a different location.

If you are no longer trading, or no longer wish to be notified about trade stands at the festival click *HERE*.

This year, we will be featuring all our traders on our web site. Please use this personal *LINK* to directly upload a photo of your stand/products and to write about what you sell.

You can also use this link to add/correct details about your business, contact information, or change your pitch(es) , give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

Photos and descriptions of your goods will be visible to the public. Personal information can only be seen by the festival committee.

Details of your pitch number, general trader information and particulars of setup and cleardown information will appear later and be visible through the link.

Save the link for future use. If you lose or forget it you will be able to request a new personal link from the website (as soon as trade applications go public).

If you have any queries that are not answered by the Trade FAQ, please contact trade@wimbornefolk.co.uk.

6.Body:
*WHO*,

As one of last year's traders at Wimborne Minster Folk Festival, you're being given an advance opportunity to book a pitch this for *THISYEAR* before we open booking to everyone.

The location we originally gave you last year was an area we hadn't previously used for trade stands, and was offered at a low price because it was an unknown. The offer we are making here is for the area you were moved to on Sunday, but the price is the price is the price for the new area and hence will be higher than the rate you paid last year.

The dates are *DATES*.

The location you are being offered is *LOCATION* at a price of *PRICE*.

If you wish to accept the offer of a pitch at the quoted price, go to your personal *LINK* and click 'accept'.

Shortly after accepting the offer, you will be sent an invoice for a deposit. To secure the pitch, you must pay your deposit promptly.

If you wish to decline the offer, please click on your personal link and click 'decline'.

Please do NOT address any queries to our treasurer unless they are related to payments. She's a very busy woman. The trade address trade@wimbornefolk.co.uk will reach Moe who can help you with everything else, including requests for a different location.

If you are no longer trading, or no longer wish to be notified about trade stands at the festival click *HERE*.

This year, we will be featuring all our traders on our web site. Please use this personal *LINK* to directly upload a photo of your stand/products and to write about what you sell.

You can also use this link to add/correct details about your business, contact information, or change your pitch(es) , give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

Photos and descriptions of your goods will be visible to the public. Personal information can only be seen by the festival committee.

Details of your pitch number, general trader information and particulars of setup and cleardown information will appear later and be visible through the link.

Save the link for future use. If you lose or forget it you will be able to request a new personal link from the website (as soon as trade applications go public).

If you have any queries that are not answered by the Trade FAQ, please contact trade@wimbornefolk.co.uk.

Han Marshall & Nathan Potter, Artisan Trade Co-ordinators.

49.Body:
Hi, *WHO*,

Less than a month to go until the 15 Feb deadline for teams to register for the festival...

If you're definitely not coming:

Please go to *LINK* and click 'Not coming'. If you think you may be able to get a team for *NEXTYEAR*, then click 'Not coming, please ask next year'.

If you're not yet certain whether you have a team:

Please go to *LINK* and click 'Possibly' and then update as soon as you know for certain.

If you are coming:

Please go to *LINK* and click 'Coming'.

Select the days that you want to dance on, and tell us the earliest time and latest times you can perform. The defaults are 10am to 5pm.

If you'd like to do extra dance spots, just increase the number shown.

Upload your public liability insurance as soon as you have the certificate, and check the other information that we have for your team.

Fill in the number of performer's wristbands required, but remember you can update this number at any time until two weeks before the festival.

Kind Regards,

Judith

61.Body:
*WHO*,
We're inviting you to join us for *FESTIVAL* *PLANYEAR* 12, 13, 14 June 2020 *WEB:*
In June 2019 we had one of our best festivals ever, with over sixty teams dancing in our lovely Dorset town. We're hoping *PLANYEAR* will be even better.
  • RSVP: If you receive this email, please could you *TICKBOX:Rec:click_this* immediately, just to say: “It arrived safely”. This lets us know that your email hasn’t bounced off a spam filter or gone to the wrong address.
  • When you know whether or not you can come: Please go to *LINK*, and change your status as appropriate. If you’re coming, please also let us know which days you want to dance. This is also a good time to update your side details and update any preferences you may have (e.g. surfaces you can dance on).
  • Dates: 12,13,14 June. You are welcome to dance on either Saturday, Sunday or both days.
  • Workshops We run a very popular programme of street workshops to engage members of the public in morris/sword dancing. If you'd be interested in running one, please let us know. (There's a box on your web record where you can talk about workshops you'd like to do).
  • Ceilidh spots: We’re also looking for teams to dance at ceilidh spots on Friday and Saturday evenings- so let us know if you’d like to do an evening slot!
  • Procession: The procession is on Saturday afternoon.
  • What's the Deadline? Early confirmations are very helpful as they help us work out how many venues we can use. (Early replies saying: 'We can't come' are also helpful.) We guarantee to fit in any team that confirms before mid February *PLANYEAR*. Teams confirming after that date may get a place, but may miss out on the most popular dance spots.
  • Times: Dancing will run from 10am to 5pm on Saturday and from 10:30am to 5pm on Sunday.
  • Timeslots: Timeslots last half an hour. Appalachian teams do a half hour on their own, morris teams share their spots with another team. (It's possible to break these rules if needed, contact us if you're an unusual case.)
  • Minimum performances: You must do at least four performances over the weekend (the procession counts as one) to qualify for a performer's weekend wristband. You’re welcome to do more (or less) if desired! Most teams do at least four performances a day.
  • Email Subject: Please keep the same subject line: (*FESTIVAL* *PLANYEAR* and *SIDE*) for all emails to the festival.
  • Wrist bands: All qualifying performers will be issued with wrist bands that give free entry into festival concerts and ceilidhs (space permitting). Our sister event, Party in the Paddock, gives free entry to wristband holders in costume (space permitting). In 2019 we offered partner wristbands at half price, and we hope to repeat this again in *PLANYEAR*. Note that wrist bands do not give free camping.
  • Camping: We don't run our own camp site, but highly recommend 'The Meadows' run by Merley Hall Farm which is only a few minutes walk from the town centre and very reasonably priced. See *WEB:InfoCamping:Camping*
  • How do I access our dance side record to enter/change details? Almost every email we send you will contain a link to your entry on our secure web server. Information like team name and costume will be visible to the public for all teams that are coming to the festival. Only the committee and yourself can see personal information like address and phone numbers. We are fully compliant with the data protection act. You can use your link to view all information held about your team by the festival, you can update/correct contact details/photo/video/blurb/etc yourself or you can even delete your entry. (Remember to click 'save changes' after any edits.)
  • Photos: By performing in the festival you consent to be filmed and photographed. Our team of photographers always take amazing photographs over the weekend, so if you want to use any of them for your teams promotional materials let us know and we’ll put you in touch with the photographer (who will almost certainly give you permission to use it).
  • Questions not covered in this email: If you've any questions and they aren't covered by our Frequently Asked Questions (a link to FAQ is at the top of your dance side record), then feel free to ask me.
  • Looking forward to seeing you at Wimborne in 2020!
Caitlin

64.Body:
*WHO*,

This is to confirm that you have accepted our offer to trade at Wimborne Minster Folk Festival in *THISYEAR*.

Please now pay your deposit of £*DEPOSIT*. You will be sent an invoice for this once it has been paid (it may take a couple of days).

*PAYCODES* At the beginning of April *THISYEAR* you will be asked to pay the balance of £*BALANCE*.

The trade address *MAILTO_trade* will reach Moe who can help you with everything else, including requests for a different location. (If you don't a reply from Moe after 7 days, your fallback contact is Brian Harries *MAILTO_chairman* )

Please use this *LINK* to add/correct details about your business, contact information, your product descriptions, book or change your pitch(es) and give power requirements, update your Insurance and Risk Assessment etc.

Details of your pitch location, general trader information and particulars of setup and clear down information will also appear there.

Save the link for future use.

*DETAILS*

74.Body:
Dear *WHO*,

I hope you are well.

You may remember that we got in touch in October 2019 inviting you to trade at the 2020 Wimborne Mister Folk Festival, offering the same pitch location as last year.

The location you are being offered is *LOCATION* at a price of *PRICE*.

As yet, we have not received a response. If this is an oversight, please kindly go to your go to your personal *LINK* and click the purple Accept button near the bottom of the page.

We do ask that you confirm one way or the other by Friday 31st January 2020, as our unallocated pitches will be offered to other Traders. We would not want you to risk losing your spot.

If you are no longer trading, or no longer wish to be notified about trade stands at the festival click *REMOVE*.

With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

75.Body:
*WHO*, Due to the Coronavirus the *FESTIVAL* 2020 is being rescheduled to 7th to 9th of August.

*WEB:*

  • RSVP: If you receive this email, please could you *TICKBOX:Rec:click_this* immediately, just to say: “It arrived safely”. This lets us know that your email hasn’t bounced off a spam filter or gone to the wrong address.
  • When you know whether or not you can come: Please go to *LINK*, and change your status as appropriate. If you’re coming, please also let us know which days you want to dance.
  • Dates: 6-9 August. You are welcome to dance on either Saturday, Sunday or both days.
  • Ceilidh spots: We’re also looking for teams to dance at ceilidh spots on Friday and Saturday evenings- so let us know if you’d like to do an evening slot!
  • Procession: The procession is on Saturday afternoon.
  • What's the Deadline? Early confirmations are very helpful as they help us work out how many venues we can use. (Early replies saying: 'We can't come' are also helpful.)
  • Times: Dancing will run from 10am to 5pm on Saturday and from 10:30am to 5pm on Sunday.
  • Timeslots: Timeslots last half an hour. Appalachian teams do a half hour on their own, Morris teams share their spots with another team. (It's possible to break these rules if needed, contact us if you're an unusual case.)
  • Minimum performances: You must do at least four performances over the weekend (the procession counts as one) to qualify for a performer's weekend wristband. You’re welcome to do more (or less) if desired! Most teams do at least four performances a day.
  • Email Subject: Please keep the same subject line: (*FESTIVAL* *PLANYEAR* and *SIDE*) for all emails to the festival.
  • Wrist bands: All qualifying performers will be issued with wrist bands that give free entry into festival concerts and ceilidhs (space permitting). Last year we offered partner wristbands at half price, and we will to repeat this again in. Note that wrist bands do not give free camping.
  • Camping: We don't run our own camp site, but highly recommend 'The Meadows' run by Merley Hall Farm which is only a few minutes walk from the town centre and very reasonably priced. See *WEB:InfoCamping:Camping*
  • How do I access our dance side record to enter/change details? Almost every email we send you will contain a *LINK* to your entry on our secure web server. Information like team name and costume will be visible to the public for all teams that are coming to the festival. Only the committee and yourself can see personal information like address and phone numbers. We are fully compliant with the data protection act. You can use your link to view all information held about your team by the festival, you can update/correct contact details/photo/video/blurb/etc yourself or you can even delete your entry. (Remember to click 'save changes' after any edits.)
  • Looking forward to seeing you at the revised Wimborne in 2020!
Caitlin

77.Body:
*WHO*, Due to the Choronovirus, the *FESTIVAL* 2020 is being rescheduled to 7th to 9th of August.

If you are able to make the new dates *TICKBOX:1:Click_Here*

If you are unable to make the new dates *TICKBOX:2:Click_Here*. We will refund any fees paid

If you are uncertain, please *TICKBOX:3:Click_Here* - so at least we know you have got the message. Then when you know, either click one of the links above or go to your *LINK* to update your status. *DETAILS* With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

Your refund request is recorded and will be processed soon by our Treasurer.

Thank you, The Wimborne Minster Folk Festival

80.Body:
*WHO*,

Thank you for letting us know you have received the change of dates. When you know please either: If you are able to make the new dates *TICKBOX:1:Click_Here*

If you are unable to make the new dates *TICKBOX:2:Click_Here*. We will refund any fees paid

Or go to your *LINK* to update your status. *DETAILS* With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

81.Body:
*WHO*,

Regarding WIMBORNE MINSTER FOLK FESTIVAL 2020

Thank you so much for agreeing to perform at Wimborne Minster Folk Festival 2020.

Sadly the current situation with Corona Virus has put the June date into question and we are rescheduling the festival to 7th - 9th of August 2020.

Please *TICKBOX:DCMRec:click_this* to let us know you have got the message.

We would be so grateful if you could fill in your availability on the revised dates on the form presented.

We do hope you are keeping well and send updates as soon as we can. With very kind regards Polly Morris (On behalf of Wimborne Minster Folk Festival)

82.Body:
*WHO*, In a move that I am sure will surprise nobody, the 2021 *FESTIVAL* has been cancelled. The 2022 festival will be from 10th to 12th of June 2022 will be our 40th *FESTIVAL*. What to do NOW:
  • Folded? If your side has folded (I know some have) please let me know and I will update our records and not bother you again.
  • RSVP: If you receive this email, please could you *TICKBOX:Rec:click_this* immediately, just to say: “It arrived safely”. This lets us know that your email hasn’t bounced off a spam filter or gone to the wrong address.
  • No longer you? If you are no longer the contact for *SIDE*, please either tell me who the current contact is, or update the contact details and forward the message to them.
You are welcome to update your details, please use this *LINK*. Normal invitations for 2022, will be sent in a few months.

Richard Proctor (Dance, Website, Tickets and Technical)

83.Body:
*WHO*,

Due to the Choronovirus, the *FESTIVAL* 2020 has been cancelled (both for the original June dates and the revised August dates).

The next festival will be on June 11th - 13th 2021. It will be the fortieth anniversary of the festival and we intend to make this a truly special event both to mark that anniversary and to make up for the loss of this year's festival.

You have paid £*PAIDSOFAR* so far.

If you would like to carry your payment(s) forward, guaranteeing your pitch and price , *TICKBOX:4:Click_Here*

If you would like a refund, *TICKBOX:5:Click_Here*. We will refund any fees paid (please allow 7 days).

If you are uncertain, please *TICKBOX:6:Click_Here* - so at least we know you have got the message. *DETAILS* With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

84.Body:
*WHO*,

Due to the Choronovirus, the *FESTIVAL* 2020 has been cancelled (both for the original June dates and the revised August dates).

The next festival will be on June 11th - 13th 2021. It will be the fortieth anniversary of the festival and we intend to make this a truly special event both to mark that anniversary and to make up for the loss of this year's festival.

*DETAILS* With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

85.Body:
*WHO"

This is to confirm, that you have transferred your trade stand booking and your fees paid from 2020 to the 2021 festival.

*DETAILS*

With best wishes from the Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Team.

86.Body:
*WHO*, After having met with our Safety Advisory Group and as a result of the continued repercussions of Covid 19, we are very sad to have to tell you that Wimborne Minster Folk Festival 2021 will have to be cancelled. However 2022 will be our 40th year and we are very much hoping that we will be able to hold a festival that is even bigger and better than ever. We will all feel like celebrating. So on that note, and I know we have been here before, if you feel that you are able to make the weekend of 10 - 12th of June 2022, and would be happy for us to pencil in the same slots as before: Please let us know by clicking on the link to our website and clicking on one of the following:
  • *TICKBOX:FCV1:Available_for_agreed_slot(s)*
  • *TICKBOX:FCV2:Not_Available*
  • *TICKBOX:FCV3:Not_yet_in_a_position_to_say*
Do feel free to email if you wish to discuss anything further We are fully aware of how hard it is to plan so far ahead, particularly at the current time, so we will confirm that you are still OK when we get to our intensive planning stage in the Autumn. Thank you so much for your patience in the face of so much uncertainty. We wish you all the best in the next weeks and months and hope that you stay well. With very kind regards Polly Morris Wimborne Minster Folk Festival Music Coordinator 2022

87.Body:
*WHO*, When we cancelled the festival for 2021, you immediately booked in for 2022. This message is just a check and a reminder. Below is the general invite we are sending - you don't need to do anything.
We're inviting you to join us for *FESTIVAL* *PLANYEAR* This will be the Fortieth *FESTIVAL* and it will be on 10th, 11th and 12th June 2021. *WEB:*
  • When you know whether or not you can come: Please go to *LINK*, and change your status as appropriate. If you’re coming, please also let us know which days you want to dance. This is also a good time to update your side details and update any preferences you may have (e.g. surfaces you can dance on).
  • Dates: 10, 11, 12 June. You are welcome to dance on either Saturday, Sunday or both days.
  • Workshops We run a very popular programme of street workshops to engage members of the public in Morris/sword/etc dancing. If you'd be interested in running one, please let us know. (There's a box on your web record where you can talk about workshops you'd like to do).
  • Ceilidh spots: We’re also looking for teams to dance at ceilidh spots on Friday and Saturday evenings- so let us know if you’d like to do an evening slot!
  • Procession: The procession is on Saturday afternoon.
  • What's the Deadline? Early confirmations are very helpful as they help us work out how many venues we can use. (Early replies saying: 'We can't come' are also helpful.) We guarantee to fit in any team that confirms before mid Feb *PLANYEAR*. Teams confirming after that date may get a place, but may miss out on the most popular dance spots.
  • Times: Dancing will run from 10am to 5pm on Saturday and from 10:30am to 5pm on Sunday.
  • Timeslots: Timeslots last half an hour. Appalachian teams do a half hour on their own, Morris teams share their spots with another team. (It's possible to break these rules if needed, contact us if you're an unusual case.)
  • Minimum performances: You must do at least four performances over the weekend (the procession counts as one) to qualify for a performer's weekend wristband. You’re welcome to do more (or less) if desired! Most teams do at least four performances a day.
  • Email Subject: Please keep the same subject line: (*FESTIVAL* *PLANYEAR* and *SIDE*) for all emails to the festival.
  • Wrist bands: All qualifying performers will be issued with wrist bands that give free entry into festival concerts and ceilidhs (space permitting). Our sister event, Party in the Paddock, gives free entry to wristband holders in costume (space permitting). They do not give free camping and cannot be transferred to someone else. We offer partner wristbands at half price. Note that wrist bands do not give free camping.
  • Camping: We don't run our own campsite. The farm that has provided camping for the last 10 years are not doing it for 2022. We are investigating another provider and will post links to that and/or other campsites on website when we know. See *WEB:InfoCamping:Camping*
  • How do I access our dance side record to enter/change details? Almost every email we send you will contain a link to your entry on our secure web server. Information like team name and costume will be visible to the public for all teams that are coming to the festival. Only the committee and yourself can see personal information like address and phone numbers. We are fully compliant with the data protection act. You can use your link to view all information held about your team by the festival, you can update/correct contact details / photo / video / blurb / etc yourself or you can even delete your entry.
  • Photos: By performing in the festival you consent to be filmed and photographed. Our team of photographers always take amazing photographs over the weekend, so if you want to use any of them for your teams promotional materials let us know and we’ll put you in touch with the photographer (who will almost certainly give you permission to use it). If you have been at Wimborne before, why not look at our *WEB:gallery/gallery.php:Gallery* and see if you can spot yourself.
  • Questions not covered in this email: If you've any questions and they aren't covered by our Frequently Asked Questions (a link to FAQ is at the top of your dance side record), then feel free to ask me.
  • Looking forward to seeing you at Wimborne in *PLANYEAR*!
Richard Proctor

  • Photos: By performing in the festival you consent to be filmed and photographed. Our team of photographers always take amazing photographs over the weekend, so if you want to use any of them for your teams promotional materials let us know and we’ll put you in touch with the photographer (who will almost certainly give you permission to use it). If you have been at Wimborne before, why not look at our *WEB:gallery/gallery.php:Gallery* and see if you can spot yourself.
  • Questions not covered in this email: If you've any questions and they aren't covered by our Frequently Asked Questions (a link to FAQ is at the top of your dance side record), then feel free to ask me.
  • Looking forward to seeing you at Wimborne in *PLANYEAR*!
Richard Proctor

89.Body:
*WHO*

I am afraid I have bad news on Camping for Wimborne Minster Folk Festival this year.

The farm that has done it for years is only doing it at £50 a head for 3 nights. For a very limited number of campers.

We had hoped to use a local school, all was agreed, then the headmaster changed and said she said no to everything.

After lots of head scratching and trying many local landowners we have to admit defeat.

Here are some lists of local camping.

*URL:www.pitchup.com/tents/England/South_West/Dorset/Wimborne/:Pitchup* *URL:www.campsites.co.uk/search/campsites-in-dorset/wimborne:Campsites.co.uk* *URL:www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Hotels-g551721-c3-zff29-Wimborne_Minster_Dorset_England-Hotels.html:Tripadvisor* If you need to change your plans please update your *LINK* appropriately. I understand. Richard A very sad dance director.

102.Body:
Good afternoon *WHO* Lots of you have been in touch about the usual discounted Morris evening tickets, they will of course still be on offer over the weekend.

To get your discounted day ticket you can visit the box office on the day that you are dancing, in kit, and ask for you/your partner to receive a morris evening ticket at £15 each. This will get you into concerts, ceilidhs, and folk dances. It does not include camping and you can't get camping on a day ticket. If any of your members need any last minute camping please let me know as soon as possible.

See you all soon

*DANCEORG*

103.Body:
Good Afternoon,

Many of you have been in contact this week worried as you have not had official communication regarding camping and rota's. PLEASE rest assured you ARE required and you have been confirmed!!

Please accept our sincere apologies for the delays in rota's - we are working tirelessly to get this to you by Thursday AM.

Due to our new system your name is all you need to secure your camping access and tickets - you DO NOT need to have any printed confirmation emails.

Unless previously arranged please arrive Friday morning from 10am to campsites and then collect tickets from the stewarding tent or relevant area on Island park.

If you are stewarding and would like to speak to someone please call 07837779728

Kind Regards,

Georgie Hooper and Laura Field
Steward Managers

110.Body: Hi, Thank you for wanting to sign up for the Chippenham Talking Folk Newsletter. To confirm it is you, please verify your email address. Click *WEB:int/MailListMgr?ACTION=Confirm&id=%ID%&k=%CONFIRM%:Here_to_Confirm*. Thank you. Chippenham Folk Festival

The Festival Team

112.Body: Dear *WHO* We are writing to you because you have been one of our valued volunteer team in previous years. We wanted to let you know that applications are now open on the website. Please follow this *LINK* to complete your application and join us in *YEAR*. Some had difficulties receiving our emails last year. Please consider adding System@chippfolk.co.uk to your accepted addresses as emails sent from our system have sometimes been filtered as spam. If you wish to be removed from this database please follow your *LINK* and click on "Remove me from the Festival Records. We look forward to hearing from you The Chippenham Folk Festival Team

113.Body:
*WHO*,

118.Body:
Dear *WHO*,

There are still spaces available for volunteers for 2024 and many who we haven't seen a response from yet, including yourself.

In case you haven't seen our previous emails, here are a few options for 2024, please complete one of these so we can get an idea of who we have/don't have.

If you would like to volunteer:-
- Use *LINK* to access your form
- Once in your application form you will need to update your preferred team, availability and camping needs.
- Lastly select 'submit' to resubmit your application.
That's it, you will get an email to let you know you have been accepted onto one of your teams of choice. and more info closer to the weekend.

If you can not/do not wish to volunteer this year:-
- Use *LINK* to access your form
- Once in your application form you will need to select the 'not this year' option at the bottom of the form.
You will not hear from us about stewarding this year but we will be back In Touch next year.

If you no longer want us to contact you about volunteering and want to be removed from our records:-
- Use *LINK* to access your form
- Once in your application form you will need to select the 'remove me from the festival records' option at the bottom of the form.
You will be removed from our database and will not hear from us until you wish to sign up again in the future.

Hopefully this all makes sense, but if not feel free to drop us an email and we can help you through the process.

If you know anyone who would like a free ticket, why not get them involved too!

Thank you for supporting the festival and we look forward to seeing you all again this year.

Laura

119.Body:
Dear *WHO*, We have been made aware that you may be receiving emails perporting to be sent with the festivals endorsement. Offering links to a "Business Directory" Please be aware that this is a SCAM. Our data base is secure and no information has been taken from it. These are chancers scanning guest lists and trying it on. Please feel free to check with us if you are concerned about any correspondence preporting to be from the Festival.

Looking forward to seeing you all soon

Dave Webber Festival Co Ordinator.

The Festival Team
